1 Plots 1.1 Line Plots 1.1.1 Basic Line Plot Create Dataframe #```{r setup, include=FALSE} #knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) #library(tidyverse) #``` #library(tidyverse) ### Create sample dataframe df <- tibble( date = seq(as.Date('2015-01-01'), as.Date('2021-08-31'), by = 'month')-1, gdp = 2 + round(runif(80, min=-1, max=1),2), pce = round(runif(80, min=-1, max=3.5),2), pceCore = pce + round(runif(80, min=-1, max=0.5),2) ) ### Prepare plotting: Convert to Longer dataframe df <- pivot_longer(df, -date, names_to = "variable", values_to = "values") ### Create Line plot with pce plotData <- df %>% filter(variable == "pce") ### Plot plot <- ggplot(plotData, aes(x = date, y = values, group = variable, color = variable)) + geom_line(size = 1)+ geom_hline(yintercept = 2, linetype = "dashed")+ theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position="bottom", legend.title = element_blank(), plot.caption=element_text(hjust=0), plot.subtitle=element_text(face="italic"), plot.title=element_text(size=16,face="bold"))+ theme(panel.grid.minor = element_line(colour = "white"))+ labs(x="Date",y="Percent", title="A title that fits", subtitle="A subtitle", caption="Source: Random numbers") plot
